sect1.title: Getting Started (Tutorial)
sect1.para: In this short tutorial, we will create simple Java application using Hazelcast distributed map and queue. Then we will run our application twice to have two nodes (JVMs) clustered and finalize this tutorial with connecting to our cluster from another Java application by using Hazelcast Native Java Client API.

listitem.para: Unzip it and add the lib/hazelcast.jar to your class path.
Create a Java class and import Hazelcast libraries.
Run this class second time to get the second node started.

para.emphasis: Connecting Hazelcast Cluster with Java Client API

listitem.para: Besides hazelcast.jar you should also add hazelcast-client.jar to your classpath.
When you run it, you will see the client properly connects to the cluster and print the map size as 3.
You can browse documentation and resources for detailed features and examples.
You can email your questions to Hazelcast mail group.
You can browse Hazelcast source code.
